title: If a man walks 6 km for 5 hours and 4 km for 12 hours, then what is the average speed? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question cannot be answered necausr it is not clearly stated. Do you mean 6 km IN 5 hours and 4 KM IN 12 hours, then the average speed is 10 km ÷ 17 hours = .588 km/hour. On the other hsnd if you mean 6 km/hour FOR 5 hours then 4 km/hour FOR 12 hours, then the average speed is 78 km ÷ 17 hours = 4.581 km/hour. The first step in solving a problem is to understand it.

Speed = 6 km/h , Time = 5 hours , Therefore Distance = 30 km. Speed = 4 km/h , Time = 12 hours ,Therefore Distance = 48 km. Combined Distance = 78 km, Combined Hours = 17 hours , Therefore Average Speed and Answer = 4.88 km/h.
he walks a total of (6X5)=30 plus (4X12)=48 for a total of 78 km. It took him 17 hours to do so. 78 km divided by 17 hours equals very close to 4.59 km per hour.
